cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to turn northwest tonight and then northward Sunday, crossing the eastern Gulf of Mexico and aiming for the northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: A Tropical Storm Warning is only in effect for the Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Florida Keys west of Seven Mile Bridge to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, west coast of the Florida peninsula, Florida Panhandle, Alabama, and portions of Mississippi coastal areas
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts possible; sustained winds mainly 20–30 mph with low (≤8%) chance of reaching 34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along west-central Florida coast; significant (>3 ft) surge not expected at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 3–5 in with local amounts up to 8 in, leading to urban and small-stream flooding around Manatee County Port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible beginning Saturday afternoon in the west-central Florida Peninsula.
